trans-unit.source: Creating a Work or School identity in Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Creating a Work or School identity in Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: Describes how to create a work or school identity from your personal identity to use with resource group templates or role-based access, among other features.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to create a work or school identity from your personal identity to use with resource group templates or role-based access, among other features.

trans-unit.source: Creating a Work or School identity in Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Creating a Work or School identity in Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: If you created a personal Azure account or have a personal MSDN subscription and created the Azure account to take advantage of the MSDN Azure credits -- you used a *Microsoft account* identity to create it.
trans-unit.target: If you created a personal Azure account or have a personal MSDN subscription and created the Azure account to take advantage of the MSDN Azure credits -- you used a *Microsoft account* identity to create it.

trans-unit.source: Many great features of Azure -- [resource group templates](../resource-group-overview.md) is one example -- require a work or school account (an identity managed by Azure Active Directory) to work.
trans-unit.target: Many great features of Azure -- [resource group templates](../resource-group-overview.md) is one example -- require a work or school account (an identity managed by Azure Active Directory) to work.

trans-unit.source: Fortunately, one of the best things about your personal Azure account is that it comes with a default Azure Active Directory domain that you can use to create a new work or school account that you can use with Azure features that require it.
trans-unit.target: Fortunately, one of the best things about your personal Azure account is that it comes with a default Azure Active Directory domain that you can use to create a new work or school account that you can use with Azure features that require it.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you were given a user name and password by an administrator, there's a good chance that you already have a work or school ID (also sometimes called an *organizational ID*).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you were given a user name and password by an administrator, there's a good chance that you already have a work or school ID (also sometimes called an *organizational ID*).

trans-unit.source: If so, you can immediately begin to use your Azure account to access Azure resources that require one.
trans-unit.target: If so, you can immediately begin to use your Azure account to access Azure resources that require one.

trans-unit.source: If you find that you cannot use those resources, you may need to return to this article for help.
trans-unit.target: If you find that you cannot use those resources, you may need to return to this article for help.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Accounts that you can use for sign in](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn629581.aspx#BKMK_SignInAccounts) and [How an Azure subscription is related to Azure AD](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn629581.aspx#BKMK_SubRelationToDir).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Accounts that you can use for sign in](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn629581.aspx#BKMK_SignInAccounts) and [How an Azure subscription is related to Azure AD](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn629581.aspx#BKMK_SubRelationToDir).

trans-unit.source: The steps are simple.
trans-unit.target: The steps are simple.

trans-unit.source: You need to locate your signed on identity in the Azure portal, discover your default Azure Active Directory domain, and add a new user to it as an Azure co-administrator.
trans-unit.target: You need to locate your signed on identity in the Azure portal, discover your default Azure Active Directory domain, and add a new user to it as an Azure co-administrator.

trans-unit.source: Locate your default directory in the Azure Portal
trans-unit.target: Locate your default directory in the Azure Portal

trans-unit.source: Start by logging in to the [Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com) with your personal Microsoft account identity.
trans-unit.target: Start by logging in to the [Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com) with your personal Microsoft account identity.

trans-unit.source: After you are logged in, scroll down the blue panel on the left side and click **ACTIVE DIRECTORY**.
trans-unit.target: After you are logged in, scroll down the blue panel on the left side and click **ACTIVE DIRECTORY**.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: Let's start by finding some information about your identity in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Let's start by finding some information about your identity in Azure.

trans-unit.source: You should see something like the following in the main pane, showing that you have one default directory.
trans-unit.target: You should see something like the following in the main pane, showing that you have one default directory.

trans-unit.source: Let's find out some more information about it.
trans-unit.target: Let's find out some more information about it.

trans-unit.source: Click the default directory row, which brings you into the default directory properties.
trans-unit.target: Click the default directory row, which brings you into the default directory properties.

trans-unit.source: To view the default domain name, click **DOMAINS**.
trans-unit.target: To view the default domain name, click **DOMAINS**.

trans-unit.source: Here you should be able to see that when the Azure account was created, Azure Active Directory created a personal default domain that is a hash value (a number generated from a string of text) of your personal ID used as a subdomain of onmicrosoft.com.
trans-unit.target: Here you should be able to see that when the Azure account was created, Azure Active Directory created a personal default domain that is a hash value (a number generated from a string of text) of your personal ID used as a subdomain of onmicrosoft.com.

trans-unit.source: That's the domain to which you will now add a new user.
trans-unit.target: That's the domain to which you will now add a new user.

trans-unit.source: Creating a new user in the default domain
trans-unit.target: Creating a new user in the default domain

trans-unit.source: Click **USERS** and look for your single personal account.
trans-unit.target: Click **USERS** and look for your single personal account.

trans-unit.source: You should see in the **SOURCED FROM** column that it is a **Microsoft account**.
trans-unit.target: You should see in the **SOURCED FROM** column that it is a **Microsoft account**.

trans-unit.source: We want to create a user in your default .onmicrosoft.com Azure Active Directory domain.
trans-unit.target: We want to create a user in your default .onmicrosoft.com Azure Active Directory domain.

trans-unit.source: We're going to follow [these instructions](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh967632.aspx#BKMK_1) in the next few steps, but use a specific example.
trans-unit.target: We're going to follow [these instructions](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh967632.aspx#BKMK_1) in the next few steps, but use a specific example.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the page, click **+ADD USER**.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the page, click **+ADD USER**.

trans-unit.source: In the page that appears, type the new user name, and make the **Type of User** a **New user in your organization**.
trans-unit.target: In the page that appears, type the new user name, and make the **Type of User** a **New user in your organization**.

trans-unit.source: In this example, the new user name is `ahmet`.
trans-unit.target: In this example, the new user name is `ahmet`.

trans-unit.source: Select the default domain that you discovered previously as the domain for ahmet's email address.
trans-unit.target: Select the default domain that you discovered previously as the domain for ahmet's email address.

trans-unit.source: Click the next arrow when finished.
trans-unit.target: Click the next arrow when finished.

trans-unit.source: Add more details for Ahmet, but make sure to select the appropriate **ROLE** value.
trans-unit.target: Add more details for Ahmet, but make sure to select the appropriate **ROLE** value.

trans-unit.source: It's easy to use **Global Admin** to make sure things are working, but if you can use a lesser role, that's a good idea.
trans-unit.target: It's easy to use **Global Admin** to make sure things are working, but if you can use a lesser role, that's a good idea.

trans-unit.source: This example uses the **User** role.
trans-unit.target: This example uses the **User** role.

trans-unit.source: (Find out more about these roles [here](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn468213.aspx#BKMK_1).) Do not enable multi-factor authentication unless you want to use multifactor authentication for each log in operation.
trans-unit.target: (Find out more about these roles [here](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn468213.aspx#BKMK_1).) Do not enable multi-factor authentication unless you want to use multifactor authentication for each log in operation.

trans-unit.source: Click the next arrow when you're finished.
trans-unit.target: Click the next arrow when you're finished.

trans-unit.source: Click the **create** button to generate and display a temporary password for Ahmet.
trans-unit.target: Click the **create** button to generate and display a temporary password for Ahmet.

trans-unit.source: Copy the user name email address, or use **SEND PASSWORD IN EMAIL**.
trans-unit.target: Copy the user name email address, or use **SEND PASSWORD IN EMAIL**.

trans-unit.source: You'll need the information to log on shortly.
trans-unit.target: You'll need the information to log on shortly.

trans-unit.source: Now you should see the new user, **Ahmet the Developer**, sourced from Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Now you should see the new user, **Ahmet the Developer**, sourced from Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: You've created the new work or school identity with Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: You've created the new work or school identity with Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: However, this identity does not yet have permissions to use Azure resources.
trans-unit.target: However, this identity does not yet have permissions to use Azure resources.

trans-unit.source: If you use **SEND PASSWORD IN EMAIL**, the following kind of email is sent.
trans-unit.target: If you use **SEND PASSWORD IN EMAIL**, the following kind of email is sent.

trans-unit.source: Adding Azure co-administrator rights for subscriptions
trans-unit.target: Adding Azure co-administrator rights for subscriptions

trans-unit.source: Now you need to add the new user as a co-administrator of your subscription so the new user can sign in to the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Now you need to add the new user as a co-administrator of your subscription so the new user can sign in to the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: To do this, in the lower-left panel click **Settings**.
trans-unit.target: To do this, in the lower-left panel click **Settings**.

trans-unit.source: In the main settings area, click **ADMINISTRATORS** at the top and you should see only your personal Microsoft account identity.
trans-unit.target: In the main settings area, click **ADMINISTRATORS** at the top and you should see only your personal Microsoft account identity.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the page, click **+ADD** to specify a co-administrator.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the page, click **+ADD** to specify a co-administrator.

trans-unit.source: Here, enter the email address of the new user you had created, including your default domain.
trans-unit.target: Here, enter the email address of the new user you had created, including your default domain.

trans-unit.source: As shown in the next screenshot, a green check mark appears next to the user for the default directory.
trans-unit.target: As shown in the next screenshot, a green check mark appears next to the user for the default directory.

trans-unit.source: Remember to select all of the subscriptions that you would like this user to be able to administer.
trans-unit.target: Remember to select all of the subscriptions that you would like this user to be able to administer.

trans-unit.source: When you are done, you should now see two users, including your new co-administrator identity.
trans-unit.target: When you are done, you should now see two users, including your new co-administrator identity.

trans-unit.source: Log out of the portal.
trans-unit.target: Log out of the portal.

trans-unit.source: Logging in and changing the new user's password
trans-unit.target: Logging in and changing the new user's password

trans-unit.source: Log in as the new user you created.
trans-unit.target: Log in as the new user you created.

trans-unit.source: You will immediately be prompted to create a new password.
trans-unit.target: You will immediately be prompted to create a new password.

trans-unit.source: You should be rewarded with success that looks like the following.
trans-unit.target: You should be rewarded with success that looks like the following.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: You can now use your new Azure Active Directory identity to use [Azure resource group templates](xplat-cli-azure-resource-manager.md).
trans-unit.target: You can now use your new Azure Active Directory identity to use [Azure resource group templates](xplat-cli-azure-resource-manager.md).
